SEARCH
Package danogl.gui.rendering

Class Camera

java.lang.Object
danogl.GameObject
danogl.gui.rendering.Camera
public class Camera extends GameObject
Represents a view of the world. The view can translate and scale (move around and zoom in and out). The camera/view may also follow an object.
Author:
Dan Nirel

  • Constructor Details

    • Camera

      public Camera(Vector2 topLeftCorner, Vector2 dimensions, Vector2 windowDimensions)
      Construct a new Camera which covers a given rectangle in the world.
      Parameters:
      topLeftCorner - world-coordinates of the top-left corner of the rectangle the camera should cover
      dimensions - the dimensions (in world-coordinates) of the rectangle the camera should cover
      windowDimensions - the dimensions, in pixels, of the window

    • Camera

      public Camera(GameObject objToFollow, Vector2 deltaRelativeToObject, Vector2 dimensions, Vector2 windowDimensions)
      Construct a new Camera which covers a given rectangle in the world.
      Parameters:
      objToFollow - a GameObject the Camera should follow around. If this parameter is null, the rectangle viewed will begin in the world origin (Vector2.ZERO).
      deltaRelativeToObject - the desired delta between the camera's center and objToFollow's center. A value of Vector2.ZERO means objToFollow will always appear in the dead center. A value of Vector2.UP.mult(50) means the object will appear slightly below the view's center. This parameter is meaningless if objToFollow is null.
      dimensions - the dimensions (in world-coordinates) of the rectangle the camera should cover
      windowDimensions - the dimensions, in pixels, of the window

  • Method Details

    • setToFollow

      public void setToFollow(GameObject objToFollow, Vector2 deltaRelativeToObject)
      Make the camera follow a given object, or stop it from following the object it currently follows.
      Parameters:
      objToFollow - If this parameter is null, the view will freeze where it is. Otherwise, follows this object around.
      deltaRelativeToObject - the desired delta between the camera's center and objToFollow's center. A value of Vector2.ZERO means objToFollow will always appear in the dead center. A value of Vector2.UP.mult(50) means the object will appear slightly below the view's center. This parameter is meaningless if objToFollow is null.

    • getObjectFollowed

      public GameObject getObjectFollowed()
      Retrieve the followed object, or null if the Camera isn't following an object

    • getDeltaRelativeToObjectFollowed

      public Vector2 getDeltaRelativeToObjectFollowed()
      Returns the delta between the camera's center and the followed object's center. This value is meaningless if the camera isn't following an object.

    • update

      public void update(float deltaTime)
      Description copied from class: GameObject
      Should be called once per frame.
      Overrides:
      update in class GameObject
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - The time elapsed, in seconds, since the last frame. Can be used to determine a new position/velocity by multiplying this delta with the velocity/acceleration respectively and adding to the position/velocity: velocity += deltaTime*acceleration pos += deltaTime*velocity

    • windowDimensions

      public Vector2 windowDimensions()
      Returns the window's dimensions

    • screenToWorldCoords

      public Vector2 screenToWorldCoords(Vector2 screenCoords)
      Converts screen coordinates (in pixels, relative to the window's top left corner), to world coordinates, according to this camera

    • worldToScreenCoords

      public Vector2 worldToScreenCoords(Vector2 worldCoords)
      Converts world coordinates to screen coordinates (in pixels, relative to the window's top left corner)
